intro: Psychotria microcephala, commonly known as the little-headed psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Psychotria microcephala is also noted for its role in ecological interactions, particularly with certain species of insects and birds.
